Intermediate Algebra_Level 4_2.json.correct_solution:
By AM-GM,
\[2 \cos \theta + \frac{1}{\sin \theta} + \sqrt{2} \tan \theta \ge 3 \sqrt[3]{2 \cos \theta \cdot \frac{1}{\sin \theta} \cdot \sqrt{2} \tan \theta} = 3 \sqrt{2}.\]Equality occurs when $\theta = \frac{\pi}{4},$ so the minimum value is $\boxed{3 \sqrt{2}}.$

generated_solutions.gemini-1.5-flash:
By AM-GM,
\[2 \cos \theta + \frac{1}{\sin \theta} \ge 2 \sqrt{2 \cos \theta \cdot \frac{1}{\sin \theta}} = 2 \sqrt{\frac{2 \cos \theta}{\sin \theta}} = 2 \sqrt{2 \cot \theta}.\]Also, by AM-GM,
\[2 \sqrt{2 \cot \theta} + \sqrt{2} \tan \theta \ge 2 \sqrt{2 \sqrt{2 \cot \theta} \cdot \sqrt{2} \tan \theta} = 4.\]Equality occurs when $2 \cos \theta = \frac{1}{\sin \theta}$ and $\sqrt{2 \cot \theta} = \sqrt{2} \tan \theta,$ or $\cos^2 \theta = \frac{1}{2},$ so the minimum value is $\boxed{4}.$
